refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: The var operator returns the variance of a set of values taken from an array attribute.

note.para: The var operator provides the same functionality as the var aggregate. For details, see the var aggregate reference.

informalexample.para: This example finds the variance of each row of a 2-dimensional array.

step.para: Create a 1-attribute, 2-dimensional array called m3x3:--afl CREATE ARRAY m3x3 <val:double>[i=0:2,3,0,j=0:2,3,0]; --show-output=no
Store values of random values between 0 and 9 in m3x3:--afl store(build(m3x3,random()%10),m3x3); --output-format=dense --chunkify=yes --show-output-in-test-file=no
Select the variance of each row of m3x3:--afl var(m3x3,val,i); --output-format=dense --show-output-in-test-file=no
